content:
15. A good example of parental upbringing is manifested in 
the son of 
A. Samuel B.   Eli C.  David D.   Asa. 
 
16. The leadership potential of David was demonstrated 
publicly for the first time when he 
A. was anointed by Samuel 
B. killed Goliath, the Philistine giant 
C. spared King Saul’s life into he cave 
D. killed two hundred Philistines. 
18. Although David refused to kill Saul because he was 
the LORD’S anointed, he still believed that 
A. Saul would be killed by the Philistines 
B. Saul would one day repent 
C. the LORD would eventually smite Saul 
D. Saul’s soldiers would cause him to die in 
battle., 
 
19. “Blessed be you, my son David! You will do many 
things and will succeed in them”, the above 
statement was made when David 
A. spared Saul’s life 
B. was blessed by his father 
C. met Saul on Mount Gillboa 
D. encountered Abner. 
 
20. Solomon asked God for wisdom to enable him 
A. live a long life 
B. deal decisively with his enemies 
C. acquire wealth and power 
D. discern what was right. 
 
21. The consequence of Rehoboam’s unwise decision at 
the time the Israelites came to him at Shechem 
eventually resulted in 
A. a rebellion 
B. a war 
C. his overthrow 
D. his fight from Jerusalem 
22. The new covenant which God was to make with the 
house of Israel was that it would be 
A. written upon their hearts 
B. for the tribe of Judah alone 
C. the means of Judah alone 
D. everlasting. 
 
23. According to Luke, John the Baptist instructed the 
multitudes that came to be baptized to 
A. flee from the coming wrath 
B. bear fruits that befit repentance 
C. be charitable to one another 
D. give thanks for being Abraham’s children. 
 
24. “Go and search diligently for the child, and when you 
have found him bring me word,…” 
The intention of the speaker in this context was to 
A. pay homage to the Lord Jesus 
B. kill all the children in the area 
C. present gifts to the child 
D. kill the child. 
 
25. Jesus was tempted in the wilderness in order to 
A. proved that He was the Son of God 
B. prepare Him for His earthly ministry 
C. prepare Him for His crucifixion 
D. appreciate the sufferings of man. 
26. One important fact about Mary brought out in Jesus 
miracle of changing water to wine was that she 
A. attended marriage feasts regularly 
B. must intercede for a miracle to occur 
C. was a sister of the bridegroom 
D. had a deep insight of her son and His ability. 
 
27. The raising of Lazarus illustrates that Jesus 
A. loved Mary and Martha 
B. was a good friend of Lazarus 
C. is the giver of life 
D. was a person of emotion 
28. “Lord, do not trouble yourself, for I am not worthy to 
have you come under my roof, …” 
The continuation of this message by the centurion 
indicated that 
A. he was afraid of Jesus 
B. he had faith in the power of Jesus’ word 
C. as a Gentile, he did not like the Jews 
D. as an army officer, he wanted to avoid contact 
with Jesus. 
 
29. The epileptic boy could not be healed by the disciples 
because  
A. they had not  ye received power 
B. the disease was incurable 
C. their prayers were not intensive enough 
D. they had to wait for Jesus 
Questions 30 an 31 are based on the Sermon on the Plain. 
 
30. The poor in spirit are promised 
A. plenty of food    B  .the kingdom of God 
C. the earth D. satisfaction. 
 
31. Those that are hated and reviled shall 
A. have a great reward in heaven 
B. See God 
C. be called sons of god 
D. receive mercy. 
 
32. Jesus’ objective for sending out the twelve was 
A. for them to teach the Gentiles about the God 
of the Jews 
B. to train the disciples in His ministry 
C. to demonstrate that He was about to be 
crucified 
D. to divert the attention of Herod from Himself. 
 
33. Who appeared and talked with Jesus during the 
transfiguration? 
A. Moses and Elijah B.   Moses and Samuel 
C. Samuel and Elisha  D. Elisha and Elijah 
 
34. “Great us to sit, one at your right hand and one at your 
left, in your glory…” 
Why was this request by the sons of Zebedee not 
granted? 
A. They were not qualified for the privilege 
B. The other disciplines disagreed with them 
C. They were unable to drink the cup 
D. It was not the duty of Jesus to grant their 
request. 
 
35. Where did Jesus lodge after he cleansed the temple?
